# Introduction

## 2018 Forest Inventory course - Collective students' work
Students, as homework, were asked to search for scientific papers presenting 'taper functions' and to compile a collective Rmarkdown document shared using GIT.  
Rearranging their work, this document lists their findings.  

# Results of students' searches

```{r results='asis', echo=FALSE}
eq.dir <- "Equations"
nart <- length(unique(sbib$ArticleID))

for(i in 1:nart) {
  zid <- szl$zid[szl$sid == i]
  cat(paste0("\n\n\n## Article ID: ", i, "                  ___", cite(zid, zbib ),"___"))
  tbl <- paste0("\n|  |  |\n",
              "|----------------|-------------------------------------------------------|\n",
              "|Student | ",
              sbib$value[sbib$ArticleID==i & sbib$field=="Student"],"|\n",
              "|Authors \n(student registration)| ",
              sbib$value[sbib$ArticleID==i & sbib$field=="Authors"],"|\n",
              "|Title \n(student registration)| ",
              sbib$value[sbib$ArticleID==i & sbib$field=="Title"],"|\n",
              "|Title \n(Zotero)| ", zbib$title[[zid]],"|\n",
              "|Species| ", sbib$value[sbib$ArticleID==i & sbib$field=="Species"],"|\n",
              "|Code| ![cod](", eq.dir, "/", 
              sbib$value[sbib$ArticleID==i & sbib$field=="Code"],")|")
  cat(tbl)
}
```
